title: The Candy Boat is back in Greater Manchester - and there'll soon be a toffee boat too

The Candy Boat is back in Manchester - and it'll soon be pulling a toffee boat along too. 
The barge packed with traditional and retro sweets was in the region last year as it made its way along the Bridgewater Canal selling treats along the way. 
After a short stint in Worsley it then made waves in Wigan and Leigh before making its way to Adlington, Chorley. 
Now owner Gail Levers is back this weekend opposite the Waterside Inn, Leigh, and has bigger plans in store. 
Gail, who runs the business with partner Trevor Wass, is planning to open up a separate boat, pulled along by The Candy Boat, but selling toffee. Read More Dessert restaurant Fireworks, Ice Cream and Desserts to open in Altrincham 
She said: "We've bought a new boat which is just an unpowered shell which candy boat tows and we are hoping to fit it out as a shop and just be able to open the sides up and we will be able to hold more stock. 
"We are just waiting for approval from the Canal and River Trust but the boat will be called Toffee Boat." Read More 
Gail said the boat was unable to stop in Worsley as made their way north earlier this week because of a stoppage, but says they plan to be there later this year. 
As well as the sweets it is also stocked with its popular flavoured fudge. 
Varieties include everything from the traditional vanilla, clotted cream and sea salted caramel to the more unusual rhubarb, whiskey, ginger and two new flavours lemon cheesecake and sour cherry. 
Gail and Trevor travel the country in the boat, which they live on with their dog Ceder. 
It will be open this Saturday and Sunday from 11am to 4pm (weather permitting). The postcode to find them is WN7 4DB. 
They are hoping the toffee boat will be ready by next year. Read More
